item.title: Report E-2024100190
item.description:
Report E-2024100190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0610 ET, XPO UPH notified ERTS of a gram release from a 55-lb. paper bag due to blocking and bracing by terminal personnel. The spill was contained to the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and were confident to clean spill without generating dust, and containerizing waste into a 10-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2024100187
item.description:
Report E-2024100187

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: KINGMAN
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2213 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UKA. It was reported that approximately 6 ounces of Gold Tone 58-DZ-1 was released from a 1-gallon metal pails due to improper bracing by terminal USB. The release impacted trailer #3112265. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. 217207-1 - 10-gallon metal drum contains three 1-gallon metal pails of Gold Tone 58-DZ-1 and oil dri.

item.title: Report X-2024100313
item.description:
Report X-2024100313

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT BROKE OPEN EXPOSING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS THERE ARE EIGHT MILWAUKEE M18 RED LITHIUM HIGH OUTPUT BATTERY PACKS THAT ARE PACKED WITH FIVE MILWAUKEE DRILLS AND ONE RAPID CHARGER. THE INNER CONTENTS WERE NOT PROTECTED AGAINST SHORT CIRCUIT OR INDIVIDUALLY ENCLOSED IN ANY WAY. OUTER BOX WAS NOT STRONG OR RIGID PACKAGING. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ARIZONA USING ACCOUNT NUMBER 880127, MCCARTHY BLDG CO'S INC, 6225 N 24TH ST STE 125, PHOENIX AZ 85016-2044.

item.title: Report E-2024100130
item.description:
Report E-2024100130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6700
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver failed to use a proper delivery hose. As the load of diesel fuel was being pumped into the customer's storage tank, the delivery hose ruptured. This allowed approximately 50 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Emergency Environmental Services responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024100052
item.description:
Report E-2024100052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 24, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged in transit and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263-impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums, and one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon steel over-pack.
